dashboard.description:
# Office 365 Migration The Office 365 migration pack will help you during your migration process, from planning to post-migration checks.
**Office 365 destinations** The full list of destinations is provided by Microsoft: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/enterprise/office-365-endpoints # Overview Monitor the status of your Office 365 migration project. **Total number of devices** * Here you can see the number of devices that are in scope for the project (i.e. both migrated and not yet migrated devices). * You can see how many are running Office 365 (as a ratio of the total and as an absolute number). * Also the number of devices still to migrate. * Below that you can find the evolution of the ratio over time.
**Satisfaction of users running Office 365** On the top, you can see the average satisfaction of end-users running Office 365, and next to it the ratio of happy users (i.e. users who are either "Very happy" or "Completely happy" after the migration).
**Application usage: top executables and average execution duration** Here you can see if users are leveraging their Office 365 packages. By highlighting what users use, you can run a campaign to understand usage patterns and discover how you can fine tune licenses to save money. You can find more details about this in the "Run: User adoption" dashboard.
::: configuration In order to take full advantage of this content pack, categories, scores and metrics need to be adjusted. **Please contact Nexthink Professional services if needed.** :::
dashboard.name: Overview

dashboard.description:
# Readiness The readiness dashboard helps validate which devices are compatible with Office 365 and which users are willing to be early adopters.
**Early adopters** The users who answered that they would like to be early adopters are listed here, so that they can be contacted.
**Unsupported devices** The devices not ready with the reason why. Devices are unsupported for OneDrive if they are unsupported for Office 365 or do not have sufficient disk space.
dashboard.name: Planning: Readiness

metric.label: Users willing to be early adopters
Users willing to be early adopters

dashboard.description:
# User satisfaction
This dashboard aims at monitoring the impact of the migration on end-users satisfaction.
**Overview** * On the top, you can see the average satisfaction of end-users using Office 365 compared to the ones not yet migrated or not using it, and next to it the number of happy users (i.e. users who are “Very happy” or “Completely happy” after the migration). * The respondents ratio and the total number of users having fully answered the campaign will be useful to evaluate if the average displayed is representative of the total population. This is typically relevant when drilling down in the hierarchy, where fewer users will influence the average more.
**Evolution and breakdowns** * The evolution of the average satisfaction is important to monitor as more and more users are migrated. It is also broken down through the hierarchy. * The feedback from end-users is broken down by level of satisfaction. This is to visualize the spread of satisfaction.
dashboard.name: Roll out: User satisfaction

dashboard.description:
# Emails migration This dashboard focuses on devices which have not yet been migrated to Office 365.
**Migration** Emails and related metadata (mailbox tree structure, agenda...) can be stored in OST and PST files on the end-user devices for different reasons (for instance for saving space on Exchange server).
The migration to Office 365 can be the occasion to import some of these files to Office 365, so that these end-users can keep their history of emails, but to also to archive or delete some of them.
This is also a way to migrate the end-users one by one in order to have more control on the migration process.
**KPIs** This dashboard uses a remote action to look for all the PST and OST files on the end-user devices, as well as their size, to help you measuring the progress on the import of these files in Office 365.
::: configuration It is necessary to edit the target investigation of the Remote Action *Get MS Office Info*. **Please contact Nexthink Professional services if needed.** :::
dashboard.name: Roll-out: Email migration
Roll-out: Network impact

dashboard.description:
# User adoption Moving to Office 365 can have a big impact on the business, especially if different productivity tools were used in the past. Moreover web apps can be used in certain scenarios to increase productivity and simplify access to common document types such as Word or PowerPoint. Monitoring user adoption is key to identifying potential issues and intervening with targeted information and education campaigns.
* Classic apps are those which have been around for a long time, such as Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote and Excel. * New apps are more recent additions to the Office suite.
::: tip **User adoption** is measured by the number of active users using an Office 365 application for at least 5 minutes in a day. :::
::: configuration **Targeted users** This dashboard only includes those users who are scheduled to use Office 365. By default we consider all non-system users, however you can customize this list by [editing the O365 user categogy](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=O365&Type=user).
**OneDrive** The OneDrive domain must be explicitly configured by [editing the O365 domain category](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=O365&Type=domain) and setting the **OneDrive** keyword. :::
dashboard.name: Run: User adoption

dashboard.description:
# User experience details
This dashboard completes the *User experience - Overview* dashboard by providing more details about issues that users may be facing with Office 365.
**Issues by location** A summary of the different Office 365 issues by location.
**Details** The Office 365 binaries with highest crash and freeze ratios are listed, as well as those with lowest network availability.
dashboard.name: Run: User experience details

tableConfig.title: O365 binaries with worst crash ratios

metric.label: Office 365 - Top 100 O365 binaries by application crash ratio

tableConfig.title: O365 binaries with worst freeze ratios

metric.label: Office 365 - Top 100 O365 binaries by application freeze ratio

tableConfig.title: O365 binaries with lowest network availabilities

metric.label: Office 365 - Top 100 O365 binaries by lowest network availability ratio

dashboard.description:
# User experience - Overview This dashboard helps you monitor your users' experiences with Office 365.
**Status** Data collected about the Office 365 stability and issues.
**What users do and don't like** Collected by a campaign to better highlight what users think about Office 365 in order to help them leverage the product.
dashboard.name: Run: User experience overview

metric.label: Devices using the wrong proxy to connect

dashboard.description:
# Version dispersion It is usually the case that different versions of Office are running throughout all the company. This dashboard helps with picturing the different versions in use for Office and for the different applications.
The last table also lists the different browsers used to connect to the Office 365 online applications.
::: configuration If you want to monitor another Office suite, you can configure the metrics and categories accordingly. :::
dashboard.name: Run: Version dispersion

tableConfig.title: Top 100 browsers used to access O365 apps

metric.label: Office 365 - Top 100 browsers used to access O365 apps
Office 365 - Top 100 Skype for Business binaries

dashboard.description:
# Adoption of Skype for Business vs GoToMeeting Here we look at the adoption of Skype for Business compared to the adoption for GoToMeeting.
Beyond that, we also look at end-user feedback on users' experiences with Skype for Business, and we identify why some users are using GoToMeeting in preference to Skype for Business.
# Potential cost savings In this subsection we look at devices with GoToMeeting whose users don't know about Skype for Business.
Given that each license for GoToMeeting costs $240 USD, we can calculate the potential cost savings which are achievable by informing users of the existence of and corporate preference for Skype for Business.
dashboard.name: Skype for Business vs GoToMeeting

metric.label: Skype for Business - Lack of adoption breakdown

tableConfig.title: Skype for Business quality - users using GoToMeeting
Skype for Business quality - all users

metric.label: Number of licenses ($240 USD per license)
